There are seven steps of water purification :
ION Exchange and Coagulation. This is the first step of the purification process. ...
Sedimentation. ...
Filtration and Granular Activated Carbon. ...
Disinfection. ...
Carbon Filters. ...
Reverse Osmosis. ...
Store Purified Water.

Water flows through a filter designed to remove particles from within it. The filters are made of layers of sand and gravel, and in some cases, crushed anthracite. Filtration collects the suspended impurities in water, enhancing the effectiveness of disinfection.

concat.scalar: The screening process in water treatment plants employs screens that have clear openings less than 6mm called fine screens. Straining is a very simple method of filtration. In this process, water is poured through a piece of cloth, which removes some of the suspended silt and solids and destroys some pathogens.

concat.scalar: Disinfectants are added to water to kill disease-causing microorganisms. Ground water sources can be disinfected by “The Water Treatment Rule,” which requires public water systems for disinfection. Chlorination, ozone, ultraviolet light, and chloramines are primary methods for disinfection.

concat.scalar: Clarification, sedimentation or flotation, are physical water treatment processes using gravity or buoyancy to remove suspended solids from water. Solid particles entrained by the turbulence of moving water may be removed naturally by sedimentation in the still water of lakes and oceans.

concat.scalar: After completion of disinfection process, the water is stored. Storage usually takes place in an underground storage tank called a “clear well”, and also in elevated storage tanks that are visible around town. There must always be an ample supply of water available in the event of emergencies.

concat.scalar: Coagulation is the chemical water treatment process used to remove solids from water, by manipulating electrostatic charges of particles suspended in water. This process introduces small, highly charged molecules into water to destabilize the charges on particles, colloids, or oily materials in suspension.

concat.scalar:
Hard water is water that has high mineral content (in contrast with "soft water"). Hard water is formed when water percolates through deposits of limestone, chalk or gypsum[1] which are largely made up of calcium and magnesium carbonates, bicarbonates and sulfates.
For more information visit : "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hard_water"

concat.scalar:
Major Causes Of Water Scarcity :-
Climate change.
Natural calamities such as droughts and floods.
Increased human consumption.
Overuse and wastage of water.
A global rise in freshwater demand.
Overuse of aquifers and its consequent slow recharge.
For more informaton : "https://byjus.com/biology/causes-of-water-scarcity/"

concat.scalar:
Water pollution can be caused in a number of ways, one of the most polluting being city sewage and industrial waste discharge. Indirect sources of water pollution include contaminants that enter the water supply from soils or groundwater systems and from the atmosphere via rain.

For more information you can visit : "https://wwf.panda.

org/discover/knowledge_hub/teacher_resources/webfieldtrips/water_pollution/#:~:text=Sources%20and%20effects%20of%20water,from%20the%20atmosphere%20via%20rain."

concat.scalar:
Contaminated water can harbor bacteria, such as those responsible for diarrhea, cholera, dysentery, typhoid, hepatitis A, and polio. According to the UN, every year, approximately 297,000 children under five die from diseases linked to poor sanitation, poor hygiene, or unsafe drinking water.
For more information visit: "https://www.medicalnewstoday.com/articles/water-pollution-and-human-
health#water-pollution-and-human-health"
